section: Section 1: Practical Skills and Field Study
objective: Develop skills in map interpretation and analysis.
content: Grid references, scales, contour lines, and identifying physical and human features.
specific_objectives: Convert between types of scales (statement, ratio, linear)
Identify features using 4-figure and 6-figure grid references
Calculate area, gradient, and distance on a topographic map
Interpret relief using contour lines and cross-sections
Differentiate between physical features and land-use patterns

objective: Analyze the physical forces that shape the Earth.
content: Plate tectonics, volcanic activity, earthquakes, and the rock cycle.
specific_objectives: Explain the theory of Plate Tectonics and types of plate boundaries
Identify the causes and effects of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes
Describe the stages of the rock cycle (Igneous, Sedimentary, Metamorphic)
Analyze the process of weathering (chemical and mechanical) and mass wasting
Discuss the formation and significance of various landforms (rivers, coasts, limestone)

objective: Explain the mechanics of weather and the impact of climate.
content: Weather elements, world climate types, and Caribbean weather systems (hurricanes).
specific_objectives: Distinguish between weather and climate
Identify weather instruments and their functions
Describe the factors influencing climate (latitude, altitude, proximity to sea)
Analyze Caribbean weather systems: cold fronts, tropical waves, hurricanes
Discuss the causes and consequences of climate change

objective: Evaluate global and regional human-environment interactions.
content: Population growth, distribution, urbanization, and sectors of economic activity (Agriculture, Tourism).
specific_objectives: Analyze population structure using population pyramids
Discuss the factors influencing population distribution and density
Explain the causes and consequences of urbanization and internal migration
Evaluate the importance of primary (agriculture/mining), secondary, and tertiary (tourism) sectors to the Caribbean economy
Analyze the environmental impact of human activities
